In, on, among. A primary preposition denoting position, and instrumentality, i.e. A relation of rest; 'in, ' at, on, by, etc.
Set apart by (or for) God, holy, sacred. From hagos; sacred.
A kiss. From phileo; a kiss.

21.str2: The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
A greeting, salutation. From aspazomai; a greeting.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.

21.parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Dative Feminine 1st Person Singular
21.str2: My, mine. From the oblique cases of ego; my.
Paul, Paulus. Of Latin origin; Paulus, the name of a Roman and of an apostle.

22.str2: If. A primary particle of conditionality; if, whether, that, etc.

22.parse: Interrogative / Indefinite Pronoun - Nominative Masculine Singular
22.str2: Any one, some one, a certain one or thing. An enclitic indefinite pronoun; some or any person or object.
No, not. Also ouk, and ouch a primary word; the absolute negative adverb; no or not.

22.parse: Verb - Present Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
22.str2: From philos; to be a friend to (an individual or an object), i.e. Have affection for; specially, to kiss.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
Lord, master, sir; the Lord. From kuros; supreme in authority, i.e. controller; by implication, Master.

22.parse: Verb - Present Imperative Active - 3rd Person Singular
22.str2: I am, exist. The first person singular present indicative; a prolonged form of a primary and defective verb; I exist.
A votive offering, a thing devoted to God; a curse, the thing cursed. From anatithemai; a ban or excommunicated.
Of Chaldee origin; maranatha, i.e. An exclamation of the approaching divine judgment.

22.parse: Verb - Aorist Imperative Active - 2nd Person Singular
22.str2: Of Chaldee origin; maranatha, i.e. An exclamation of the approaching divine judgment.

23.str2: The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
From chairo; graciousness, of manner or act.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
Lord, master, sir; the Lord. From kuros; supreme in authority, i.e. controller; by implication, Master.
Of Hebrew origin; Jesus, the name of our Lord and two other Israelites.
(a) gen: with, in company with, (b) acc: (1) behind, beyond, after, of place, (2) after, of time, with nouns, neut. of adjectives.

23.parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Genitive 2nd Person Plural
23.str2: You. The person pronoun of the second person singular; thou.

24.parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Genitive 1st Person Singular
24.str2: I, the first-person pronoun. A primary pronoun of the first person I.
From agapao; love, i.e. Affection or benevolence; specially a love-feast.
(a) gen: with, in company with, (b) acc: (1) behind, beyond, after, of place, (2) after, of time, with nouns, neut. of adjectives.
All, the whole, every kind of. Including all the forms of declension; apparently a primary word; all, any, every, the whole.

24.parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Genitive 2nd Person Plural
24.str2: You. The person pronoun of the second person singular; thou.
In, on, among. A primary preposition denoting position, and instrumentality, i.e. A relation of rest; 'in, ' at, on, by, etc.
Anointed One; the Messiah, the Christ. From chrio; Anointed One, i.e. The Messiah, an epithet of Jesus.
Of Hebrew origin; Jesus, the name of our Lord and two other Israelites.
Of Hebrew origin; properly, firm, i.e. trustworthy; adverbially, surely.
